definition[0]: approval of something, especially from an important person
example[0]: His actions have the imprimatur of the Secretary of State.
definition[1]: official permission to print a book, given by the Roman Catholic Church
definition[2]: approval of something, given by an official authority or an important person
example[1]: The campaign has the imprimatur of the President.
example[2]: The work was published under the imprimatur of Goldman Sachs Investment Research.
